qas.question: Who makes the claim that Hayek was actually a conservative?
According to Pirie, conservatives dislike change only when its forced upon them by whom?

answers.text: people in authority who think they know how to run things better

qas.question: Pirie believes Hayek to be a conservative for what reason?

answers.text: mistakes the nature of the conservative outlook

qas.question: What does Pirie claim conservatives want for the free market?

context: In Why F A Hayek is a Conservative, British policy analyst <a0_0>Madsen Pirie<a0_0/> claims Hayek <a2_0>mistakes the nature of the conservative outlook<a2_0/>. Conservatives, he says, are not averse to change – but like Hayek, they are highly averse to change being imposed on the social order by <a1_0>people in authority who think they know how to run things better<a1_0/>. They wish to allow the market <a3_0>to function smoothly<a3_0/> and give it the freedom to change and develop. It is an outlook, says Pirie, that Hayek and conservatives both share.
